captions.text:
Okay we gotta talk about The Great Gatsby.
Gatsby? What Gatsby?

The Great Gatsby. The Leonardo Dicaprio movie
that we just saw. We gotta talk about that.

Why?
Because last week we said we were gonna talk

about Iron Man 3, and you derailed the conversation
like you usually do, and people got upset

that we didn't actually talk about the movie.
If you wanna talk about Iron Man 3, then we

can do it. It sucked balls.
I thought you said you liked it. You said

it was awesome.
That was before I actually saw it.

Listen, the twist is terrible, Pepper does
some ridiculous sh*t, and for the second Iron

Man movie in a row, there's like almost no
Iron Man.

I think the ship has sailed on the Iron Man
3 conversation. People don't want to tune

into a Great Gatsby conversation and hear
us talk about Iron Man 3. And the cycle will

continue on and on. We gotta talk about The
Great Gatsby.

Fine but I have the same problem that I had
last week. I mean, I don't want to spoil the

movie for these people. It's opening day!
There are ways to talk about a movie without

spoiling it. Okay? Like, why don't you just
name something you liked.

Okay.
Okay, why don't you try naming something that

you didn't like. I think that's probably easier
for you.

That's a lot easier. To start with, it's too
faithful to the book.

Too faithful to the book?! Too faithful to
the book?! How is that possible?

Baz Luhrmann should have taken more liberties,
man.

"Too faithful to the book?!" I don't think
I've ever even heard of that.

Have you ever read The Great Gatsby?
Yeah, but it was a long time ago. I don't

really remember it very well.
Yeah, well consider yourself lucky. It's boring.

Dude, it's a classic!
Yeah, classically boring. It is the least

exciting book ever. It's the Mad Men of books.
Alright? It may be brilliant, but it's too,

f*cking, slow.
You have the attention span of a five year

old, alright? What else didn't you like? Anything
else?

Tobey Maguire narrates the whole freaking
movie. This is what you do, when you try and

film a book that's in the first person with
tons of narration, and you realize, "Oh sh*t,

I've gotta do lots of voiceover." Why not
just film Toby Maguire, the actor, sitting

on a stool reading the book and call it a
day?

Right, because that would be entertaining
for everyone. Bill the movie as Peter Parker

reads "The Great Gatsby."
Andrew Garfield is Peter Parker, not Toby

MaGuire, and that's like one of the only things
the new Spider-man movie got right.

Alright. Alright. Well, did you at least like
Leonardo Dicaprio? Did you at least think

Leo was good in the movie.
Leonardo Dicaprio was a good Gatsby.

Okay.
He was, you know, he was a good Gatsby. But

was he a great Gatsby? I don't know. He sounds
pretty goofy saying stuff like "old sport."

Everybody sounds goofy saying "old sport."
Even people that lived in the 20's sounded

goofy saying "Old sport." That's, like, the
whole point.

That's a pretty stupid reason to write a whole
book.

Did you at least find the movie visually stimulating
in any way?

Yes, but I found Prometheus visually stimulating.
But I just found the story to be a snoozer.

Great Gatsby the film may look pretty, alright?
But the story's got as much pep as a Model-T.

You can't blame the director for the story!
I can blame him for choosing to adapt this

book into a movie. Yeah, I certainly can.
No one put a gun to his head.

Well, I thought it was great, okay?
Yeah, well you liked Moulin Rouge.

A lot of people like Moulin Rouge.
Well a lot of people are stupid.

You don't have a lot of friends, do you?
The movie's gorgeous, the--

Yeah, until Jay-Z shows up and pulls you right
out of the time period.

That's a stylistic choice, alright? I thought
it was bad-ass. Jay-Z is a lot like Gatsby,

actually.
That's racist.

Not it's not!
Listen why can't you just accept the fact

that some books are unfilmable.
Life Of Pi was supposed to be unfilmable,

right? And then Ang Lee came along and won
an Oscar for it.

Richard Pahkah!
I just walked right into that one, didn't
I?

title: The Great Gatsby - Conversations With Myself About Movies
